greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Tree of Lucky sieve, mirrored: a(0) = 1, a(1) = 2; after which a(2n) = 2*a(n), a(2n+1) = A269369(a(n)).
comment: Permutation of natural numbers obtained from the Lucky sieve. Note the indexing: Domain starts from 0, range from 1.

This sequence can be represented as a binary tree. Each left hand child is obtained by doubling the parent's contents, and each right hand child is obtained by applying A269369 to the parent's contents:
Sequence A269377 is obtained from the mirror image of the same tree.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..4095
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: As a composition of related permutations:
A000035(a(n)) = A000035(n). [This permutation preserves the parity of n from a(2)=4 onward.]
xref: Cf. A000959 (with 2 inserted between 1 and 3 forms the right edge of the tree).
Related or similar permutations: A163511, A260742, A269377.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 01 2016
